articles.headline: Three Separate, Equal and Dysfunctional Branches of Government
articles.snippet: The continuing breakdown in Washington’s ability to govern seemed to spread like a contagion on Thursday through all three branches of government.
articles.abstract: The continuing breakdown in Washington’s ability to govern seemed to spread like a contagion on Thursday through all three branches of government.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The continuing breakdown in Washington’s ability to govern seemed to spread like a contagion Thursday through all three branches of government.

articles.headline: Testing the Clean-Energy Logic of a Tesla-SolarCity Merger
articles.snippet: Whether Elon Musk’s “vertically integrated energy company” is the right model, some experts see virtue in the theory.
articles.abstract: Whether Elon Musk’s “vertically integrated energy company” is the right model, some experts see virtue in the theory.
articles.lead_paragraph: Imagine a world in which every home and building is a miniature power plant, with solar panels on the roofs and electric vehicles and stationary battery banks in the garages.

articles.headline: Led Zeppelin Did Not Steal ‘Stairway to Heaven,’ Jury Says
articles.snippet: A federal jury said the hit song did not contain enough similarities to “Taurus,” a song released three years earlier by the band Spirit.
articles.abstract: A federal jury said the hit song did not contain enough similarities to “Taurus,” a song released three years earlier by the band Spirit.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — It’s long, it’s classic and, a jury decided on Thursday, it’s an original.
articles.byline: By Noah Gilbert and Ben Sisario

articles.headline: ‘Leave’ Takes the Lead as Britain Awaits Outcome of E.U. Referendum
articles.snippet: The vote on Britain’s continued membership in the European Union sent currency traders scrambling and the pound first up and then down.
articles.abstract: The vote on Britain’s continued membership in the European Union sent currency traders scrambling and the pound first up and then down.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Supporters of a British exit from the European Union opened up a substantial lead over advocates of staying in the bloc as the nation tallied the votes early Friday on one of its most momentous decisions in generations.

articles.headline: Nation’s Biggest Banks Would All Withstand Recession, Fed Says
articles.snippet: In its annual stress tests, the Fed looked at how America’s 33 largest banks would do in a recession with sustained high unemployment and negative interest rates.
articles.abstract: In its annual stress tests, the Fed looked at how America’s 33 largest banks would do in a recession with sustained high unemployment and negative interest rates.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s biggest banks have all built up big enough buffers to weather a severe recession in decent shape, United States regulators said on Thursday.
articles.byline: By Nathaniel Popper and Michael Corkery

articles.headline: A Russian Oil Company Is for Sale — Again
articles.snippet: In a yo-yo privatization pattern, cash-hungry Russia is offering stakes in an oil company it privatized in the 2000s and recently repossessed.
articles.abstract: In a yo-yo privatization pattern, cash-hungry Russia is offering stakes in an oil company it privatized in the 2000s and recently repossessed.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — For sale in Russia this summer: one repossessed asset, well loved and maintained. Seller is motivated. Everything must go.

articles.headline: YouTube Red Buys ‘Step Up,’ Its First Big-Budget TV Drama
articles.snippet: The move puts the streaming service in more direct competition with the likes of Netflix and traditional cable networks.
articles.abstract: The move puts the streaming service in more direct competition with the likes of Netflix and traditional cable networks.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — YouTube Red, the Google-owned paid streaming service, has acquired its first big-budget, Hollywood-produced television drama, moving it into more direct competition with players like Netflix and traditional cable networks.

articles.headline: Britain Votes to Leave E.U.; Cameron Plans to Step Down
articles.snippet: The British pound and stock prices plummeted, there was immediate pressure for another referendum on Scottish independence, and David Cameron said he would resign by October.
articles.abstract: The British pound and stock prices plummeted, there was immediate pressure for another referendum on Scottish independence, and David Cameron said he would resign by October.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Britain has voted to leave the European Union, a historic decision sure to reshape the nation’s place in the world, rattle the Continent and rock political establishments throughout the West.

articles.headline: Populist Anger Upends Politics on Both Sides of the Atlantic
articles.snippet: Britain’s vote to leave the European Union brings into focus the power of disaffected voters to force change on a reluctant establishment.
articles.abstract: Britain’s vote to leave the European Union brings into focus the power of disaffected voters to force change on a reluctant establishment.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — From Brussels to Berlin to Washington, leaders of the Western democratic world awoke Friday morning to a blunt, once-unthinkable rebuke delivered by the flinty citizens of a small island nation in the North Atlantic. Populist anger against the established political order had finally boiled over.
